greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest k >= 0 such that 9^k has exactly n 0's in its decimal representation.
mathematica: a = {}; Do[k = 0; While[ Count[ IntegerDigits[9^k], 0] != n, k++ ]; a = Append[a, k], {n, 0, 50} ]; a
program: (PARI) A063626(n)=for(k=0, oo, #select(d->!d, digits(9^k))==n&&return(k)) \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Jun 15 2018
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 10 2001
ext: a(0) changed to 0 (as in A031146, A063555, ...) and better title from _M. F. Hasler_, Jun 15 2018
